# Inclass_ex05: Geographically Weighted Statisticss-gwModel method
## Import data and package

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman :: p_load(sf,spdep,tmap,tidyverse,knitr,GWmodel)
```
:::

### impot hunnan data shapefile

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hunan_sf <- st_read(dsn ="data/geospatial" , layer ="Hunan")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `Hunan' from data source 
  `/Users/liangyuhang/Downloads/Maaaaaaaaaark/IS415_g/In-class_Ex/In-class_Ex05/data/geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 88 features and 7 fields
Geometry type: POLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 108.7831 ymin: 24.6342 xmax: 114.2544 ymax: 30.12812
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
```


:::
:::

### import hunan_2012.shapefile

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hunan2012 <- read_csv("data/aspatial/hunan_2012.csv")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Rows: 88 Columns: 29
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (2): County, City
dbl (27): avg_wage, deposite, FAI, Gov_Rev, Gov_Exp, GDP, GDPPC, GIO, Loan, ...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```


:::
:::

### join hunan and hunan_2012 data frame

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hunan <- left_join(hunan_sf,hunan2012)%>%
  select(1:3, 7,15, 16,31,32)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Joining with `by = join_by(County)`
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
write_rds(hunan_sf,"data/rds/hunan_sf.rds")
```
:::

::: {.cell}

:::


## converting to SpatialpolygonDataFrame

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hunan_sp <- hunan%>%
  as_Spatial()
```
:::

### AIC

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
bw_AIC <- bw.gwr(GDPPC ~ 1, data = hunan_sp, approach = "AIC", adaptive = TRUE, kernel = "bisquare", longlat = T)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Adaptive bandwidth (number of nearest neighbours): 62 AICc value: 1923.156 
Adaptive bandwidth (number of nearest neighbours): 46 AICc value: 1920.469 
Adaptive bandwidth (number of nearest neighbours): 36 AICc value: 1917.324 
Adaptive bandwidth (number of nearest neighbours): 29 AICc value: 1916.661 
Adaptive bandwidth (number of nearest neighbours): 26 AICc value: 1914.897 
Adaptive bandwidth (number of nearest neighbours): 22 AICc value: 1914.045 
Adaptive bandwidth (number of nearest neighbours): 22 AICc value: 1914.045 
```


:::
:::

### Cross-validation

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
  bw_CV <- bw.gwr(GDPPC ~ 1, 
                  data = hunan_sp, 
                  approach = "CV", 
                  adaptive = TRUE, 
                  kernel = "bisquare", 
                  longlat = T)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Adaptive bandwidth: 62 CV score: 15515442343 
Adaptive bandwidth: 46 CV score: 14937956887 
Adaptive bandwidth: 36 CV score: 14408561608 
Adaptive bandwidth: 29 CV score: 14198527496 
Adaptive bandwidth: 26 CV score: 13898800611 
Adaptive bandwidth: 22 CV score: 13662299974 
Adaptive bandwidth: 22 CV score: 13662299974 
```


:::
:::

### computing geographically wieghted summary statics

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
gwstat <- gwss(data = hunan_sp,
               vars ="GDPPC",
               bw=bw_AIC,
               kernel = "bisquare",
               adaptive = TRUE,
               longlat = T)
```
:::


### prepare data

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
gwstat_df <- as.data.frame(gwstat$SDF)
```
:::

### cbhind() is used to ppend the newly drived 

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hunan_gstat <- cbind(hunan_sf,gwstat_df)
```
:::


## Visualising

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(hunan_gstat) +
  tm_fill("GDPPC_LM",
          n=5,
          style = "quantile")+
  tm_borders(alpha=0.5)+
  tm_layout(main.title = "Distribution of ",
            main.title.position = "center",
            legend.title.size=2.0,
            legend.text.size = 1.2,
            legend.height = 1.50,
            legend.width = 1.50,
            frame= TRUE)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}

:::
